title: Gas Prices Climb In Maryland
body: BALTIMORE (WBFF) -  For another week, Maryland drivers saw increases at the pump with a statewide increase of four cents as the spring driving season continues.The largest increase is in Salisbury, which experienced a nine-cent jump this week. Both Cumberland and Hagerstown saw only a penny increase on the week. Annapolis saw a four-cent increase; Baltimore encountered a five-cent increase and Frederick saw a six-cent increase.According to new data from the Energy Information Administration (EIA), total domestic refinery utilization increased to 86.5 percent last week amid a slight drop in demand. The demand decrease helped to limit price increases, but American drivers should expect continued price fluctuations at the pump in the lead up to Memorial Day Weekend and the start of the summer driving season. April saw mostly stable prices with the national average only climbing two cents on the month.The gas price average in Maryland today is $2.86, up respectively four cents from last week, eight cents in the last month, and 99 cents from this date last year.Today’s national gas price average is $2.95, a nickel away from the dreaded $3 a gallon threshold. It is up respectively six cents in the last week, eight cents in the last month, and $1.14 from this time last year.The national gas average has not hit $3 since October 31, 2014. The next closest date was in May 25, 2018 at $2.96. Maryland’s gas average has not hit $3 since October 26, 2014.
